comments.body:
So turning this around here is not needed, as $source_username cannot be a collection.
I think that's why we disabled that rule in pslint, so we didn't *have* to comply with something that is futile.
You are right it isn't needed here but I've started to get into the habit of doing this everywhere. I don't want to force other people to comply but I have started to do it myself.
I had hoped it wouldn't have come this far, but I don't disagree. At least it's easier than second guessing or leaving it up to a static analyzer (which are still not perfect wrt. this).

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +131,135 @@
    # add optional arguments from user input
    if ($null -ne $source_username) {
        $arguments.Add("--user") > $null
        $arguments.Add($source_username) > $null

comments.body: @jborean93 could I ask that you raise an issue about this on chocolatey/choco?  There might already be an issue about this, so if you could check that would be great.
I had a brief search and couldn't fine one, have raised the issue here https://github.com/chocolatey/choco/issues/1614.
